plugins.name: Thumbnail Setter
plugins.description:
Easily create thumbnails from almost any selection, without needing to manually wrap layers; in both Figma and FigJam.


Figma typically requires frames, components, component sets, or sections to create a thumbnail, but with Thumbnail Setter, you can select multiple layers or component instances, and the plugin will automatically frame them in the background before setting the thumbnail.


In FigJam, where only sections can typically be thumbnails, this plugin allows you to create thumbnails from any selection, even from instances directly within FigJam – without needing to predefine them in Figma (which was the only workaround).


How to use in Figma:

  1. Select the layer(s) you want as a thumbnail.
  2. Press Cmd+K (Mac) or Ctrl+K (Windows) to open the Action menu.
  3. Switch to the Plugins & Widgets tab.
  4. Search for "Thumbnail Setter" and run it.


How to use in FigJam:

  1. Select the element(s) you want as a thumbnail.
  2. Press Shift+I to open the Insert panel.
  3. Switch to the Plugins tab.
  4. Search for "Thumbnail Setter" and run it.

From now on, you can also use Quick actions (Cmd+K or Ctrl+K).


Limitation: The plugin won’t work if you select multiple layers, including a section. However, single section selections work fine.


Feel free to share your feedback and help me make Thumbnail Setter even better!
plugins.tagline: Quickly convert any selection into a thumbnail, in both Figma and FigJam.

plugins.name: Dola Project Starter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you, in one click, set up a new project with a good practice pages structure, variables and styles!


Generated styles and variables are based on Tailwind standards which is eliminating the gap between design and development styling primitives and improving the workflow out of the box.


This starter sets up:

  • color variables (primary shades, grays, destructive, border, etc.)
  • spacings variables
  • border radius variables
  • drop shadow effects
  • text styles (like text-2xl/font-bold, etc.)
  • grid styles (base, md, lg, xl, 2xl)
  • pages structure
  • file cover page


And many might be planned, such as:

  • generated style guide based on styles
  • components (buttons, toggles, image ratios, etc)
  • tailwind config export for developers
  • and maybe something else..


So stay tuned, and leave you feedback about what should we improve or add next.


With love,

Dola Service Team ❤️

accepted.name: Oleksandr Ploskovytskyy
accepted.description: Software Engineer

plugins.tagline: One-click project starter with Tailwind text, shadow, grid styles and pages structure

plugins.name: 画板json导出 Export Frame JSON
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin is designed to help users export detailed JSON data of selected nodes, including auto layout information, Frame nesting relationships, text properties, and more. With this plugin, users can easily retrieve structured data from design elements, facilitating data analysis, secondary development, or documentation.


功能

  1. Export complete JSON data of selected nodes, including properties like type, name, size, position, fills, strokes, and more.
  2. Support exporting text content, font name, font size, and other properties of text nodes.
  3. Support nested export of nodes such as Frame, Group, Component, and Instance, preserving the full hierarchical structure.
  4. Complete export of auto layout information, including layout mode, primary and secondary axis alignment, padding, and spacing.
  5. Safely serialized JSON data export ensures compatibility and completeness.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select one or more nodes from which you want to export data.
  2. Click the export button in the plugin, and the plugin will automatically extract all relevant information from the selected nodes and generate JSON data.
  3. The exported JSON data will be displayed in the plugin interface, allowing users to copy or download it for further use.


Notes

  1. This plugin currently supports exporting properties of common node types such as Frame.
  2. Ensure that the selected node types are supported by the plugin; otherwise, related data might not be exportable.
  3. If errors occur during the export process, check whether the nodes contain excessive nesting or complex properties. Simplify the structure if needed and try again.


简介

本插件旨在帮助用户导出选定节点的详细 JSON 数据，包括节点的自动布局信息、Frame 嵌套关系、文本属性等。通过此插件，用户可以轻松地获取设计元素的结构化数据，便于进行数据分析、二次开发或文档记录。


功能

  1. 导出选定节点的完整 JSON 数据，包括节点的类型、名称、尺寸、位置、填充、边框等属性。
  2. 支持导出文本节点的文本内容、字体名称、字号等属性。
  3. 支持 Frame、Group、Component、Instance 等节点类型的嵌套导出，保留完整的层次结构。
  4. 自动布局信息的完整导出，包括布局模式、主次轴对齐方式、填充和间距等。
  5. 导出的 JSON 数据经过安全序列化，确保兼容性和完整性。


使用说明

  1. 选中一个或多个需要导出数据的节点。
  2. 在插件中点击导出按钮，插件将自动提取选定节点的所有相关信息并生成 JSON 数据。
  3. 导出的 JSON 数据将会显示在插件界面中，用户可以复制或下载该数据用于其他用途。


注意事项

  1. 本插件目前只支持导出 Frame节点类型的属性。
  2. 请确保选定的节点类型受插件支持，否则可能无法导出相关数据。
  3. 如果导出过程中出现错误，请检查节点是否包含过多层次的嵌套或复杂的属性，建议简化结构后再试。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: 画板json导出插件允许你轻松导出所选 frame 的 JSON 数据。通过简单的操作，你可以快速获取 Figma 设计中的 frame 属性，并将其复制用于其他开发或设计需求。

plugins.name: Variables Exporter For Dev Mode
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to extract a comprehensive JSON representation of all the variables used within a Figma document. This JSON output can serve as a foundation for transforming design variables into cross-platform design tokens—for example, generating Tailwind CSS classes or integrating them into a design token pipeline like Style Dictionary.


The exported format is intentionally rich and flexible, enabling developers to write custom scripts or transformations as needed. However, the plugin also offers two configuration options that reduce the need for manual preprocessing—saving time and making integration into developer workflows more seamless:


Resolve Aliases


When enabled, this option resolves all aliases to their final, underlying values. The plugin supports cascading resolution, meaning it can follow chains of aliases until it reaches a concrete value.


A key feature here is the smart handling of multi-mode variable collections. If variables are connected through multi-mode collections, the plugin attempts to match modes based on slugified mode names. If no match is found, the target collection’s default mode is used instead.


Importantly, the resolution is always based on the original mode name—not the fallback.


Example:


The variable primary in the light mode of the semantics collection points to the variable blue in the primitives collection (which only contains the dark mode). That variable in turn points to blue-500 in the palettes collection, which contains both light and dark modes. In this case, resolution ultimately lands on blue-500 in the light mode, even though the intermediate blue variable belongs to a dark-only collection.


Exclude Hidden Variables


This option filters out any variables that have the "Hide from publishing" checkbox enabled in Figma.


When aliases are involved, any variable pointing to a hidden variable will still follow the alias resolution rules described above. This ensures that the exported JSON always contains usable and resolved values, even if some variables are marked as hidden in the Figma UI.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to JSON-based format

133639.name: Variables Exporter For Dev Mode
133639.description:
This plugin allows you to extract a comprehensive JSON representation of all the variables used within a Figma document. This JSON output can serve as a foundation for transforming design variables into cross-platform design tokens—for example, generating Tailwind CSS classes or integrating them into a design token pipeline like Style Dictionary.


The exported format is intentionally rich and flexible, enabling developers to write custom scripts or transformations as needed. However, the plugin also offers two configuration options that reduce the need for manual preprocessing—saving time and making integration into developer workflows more seamless:


Resolve Aliases


When enabled, this option resolves all aliases to their final, underlying values. The plugin supports cascading resolution, meaning it can follow chains of aliases until it reaches a concrete value.


A key feature here is the smart handling of multi-mode variable collections. If variables are connected through multi-mode collections, the plugin attempts to match modes based on slugified mode names. If no match is found, the target collection’s default mode is used instead.


Importantly, the resolution is always based on the original mode name—not the fallback.


Example:


The variable primary in the light mode of the semantics collection points to the variable blue in the primitives collection (which only contains the dark mode). That variable in turn points to blue-500 in the palettes collection, which contains both light and dark modes. In this case, resolution ultimately lands on blue-500 in the light mode, even though the intermediate blue variable belongs to a dark-only collection.


Exclude Hidden Variables


This option filters out any variables that have the "Hide from publishing" checkbox enabled in Figma.


When aliases are involved, any variable pointing to a hidden variable will still follow the alias resolution rules described above. This ensures that the exported JSON always contains usable and resolved values, even if some variables are marked as hidden in the Figma UI.
133639.release_notes: Allow to select types to include
133639.tagline: Export Figma variables to JSON-based format

plugins.name: Instance Generator
plugins.description:
\\ 記事を書きました！使い方等もこちらに詳しく記載しています！ //

CSVからインスタンスを一括生成するFigmaプラグインを作ってみた


概要

対象のコンポーネントのプロパティをカラムにもつCSVデータから、そのコンポーネントのインスタンスを一括生成するためのプラグインです。


ユースケースとしては、

  • 社員用の名刺データの一括生成
  • コピーライトがデザインにハマるかの大量のパターン比較

などのデザイン作業が必要だけど、データ管理をCSVで行った方が効率的な可能性がある場合を想定しています。


使い方

  1. コピー元となるコンポーネントと出力先となるフレームを作成します。
  2. コンポーネントの中で可変になる部分をプロパティ化します。
  3. プロパティ名がカラムとなった CSV データを用意します。
  4. Figma でデザインファイルを開き、「元となるコンポーネント」と「出力先のフレーム」を選択した状態で本プラグインを実行します。
  5. プラグインの中で、先ほど作成した CSV データを選択し、「作成する」ボタンを押します
  6. 出力先のフレームに CSV データから生成されたインスタンスが一括作成されます。

accepted.name: Takashi Nemoto
accepted.description: Web Engineer

plugins.tagline: CSVからインスタンスを生成するプラグイン

plugins.name: Path Arrows
plugins.description:
Easily create clear visual connections between objects in your interface using arrows — fast, simple, and without any manual work. This plugin is perfect for showcasing screen transitions, button interactions, and other UI element relationships.


Here’s how it works:


1. Select the first object (the starting point of the arrow).

2. Then select the second object (the destination).

3. Choose the sides for connection (e.g., left to right or top to bottom).

4. Click the button — the plugin will automatically draw a clean arrow between the two.


It’s a quick and intuitive way to map out user flows, demonstrate interactions, or organize your layout visually


This is the MVP version — more updates are on the way. Your feedback means a lot!

plugins.name: 中文文本样式替换 CN Auto Adapt Helper
plugins.description:
介绍

CN Auto Adapt Helper 是一款支持 Figma 中文与英文文本样式一键切换的插件，助力跨语言界面设计快速适配。


功能说明

  1. 自动识别英文样式并替换为中文样式
  2. 支持单行与多行文本样式替换
  3. 保持原有文本结构与排版不变
  4. 一键切换中文/英文模式，操作可逆
  5. 实时显示处理统计和失败信息


使用方法

  1. 选中一个或多个包含文本样式的图层或组件
  2. 点击“切换中文模式”或“切换英文模式”按钮
  3. 插件将自动完成样式匹配与替换
  4. 处理结果将在底部统计区域展示


注意事项

  1. 仅对存在样式 ID 的文本图层生效
  2. 样式命名需符合设计规范中中英命名映射关系
  3. 若未匹配成功则可能跳过或统计为失败项


Introduction

CN Auto Adapt Helper helps you automatically switch between English and Chinese text styles in Figma, streamlining multilingual UI design.


Function Description

  1. Automatically replaces text styles based on language mode
  2. Supports both single and multi-line styles
  3. Keeps text structure and layout unchanged
  4. One-click toggle between CN and EN modes
  5. Real-time processing stats and error tracking


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text layers or components.
  2. Click “Switch to Chinese Mode” or “Switch to English Mode”.
  3. Plugin will automatically match and replace the corresponding text styles.
  4. View results in the statistics panel.


Notes

  1. Only works when text layers have recognized style IDs.
  2. Style name mappings must align with your design system’s naming convention.
  3. Fallback may occur if the style ID is missing or not matched.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Auto-swap text styles between CN and EN modes

plugins.name: ColorAura - Enhanced Shade Generator
plugins.description:
ColorAura - Enhanced Shade Generator


ColorAura turns the creation of color shades into an exact science. Using a mathematically calibrated super elliptic curve, the plugin generates professional color scales that can be customized to fit any project's needs.


Key features:

  1. Create hues based on a super elliptic curve for smooth and natural transitions
  2. Full integration with Figma Variables for a systematic approach to color
  3. Non-linear distribution for more precise gradation control
  4. Automatic text adaptation (black/white) depending on background brightness
  5. Intuitive interface with real-time visual previews


Customization for your needs:

Take full control of your color scales with adjustable super ellipse settings and distribution types. Choose between linear and step distributions, include white and black colors in your palette, or create variable-free palettes for rapid prototyping. The possibilities are endless.


Working with variables:

ColorAura seamlessly integrates with Figma Variables, automatically creating and organizing color variables into a clean, hierarchical structure. Each shade gets a meaningful name in the format "ColorName/Percent", making them intuitive to use across your design system.


Questions and Support:

For suggestions, bug reports, or general feedback, please reach out through the Figma Community or connect with me on social media (@ninsent). Your input helps make ColorAura better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Superelliptic curve-based generator for perfect tints & shades

plugins.name: Ollama Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Ollama Auto Fill


Before Use:

Please install and run Ollama according to my tutorial:


  1. Tutorial: document
  2. For more information, please visit my official website: https://figma.comfyui.asia


Description

Ollama Auto Fill is a powerful Figma plugin that leverages the Ollama local large language model to automatically generate and fill text content. Designed specifically for designers, this tool can quickly generate multiple unique text items and automatically populate them into selected Figma text components, significantly enhancing design efficiency.


Key Features

• Generate high-quality text using the Ollama local large language model

• Support batch generation of multiple unique text items

• Automatically fill generated text into selected Figma text components

• Clean and intuitive user interface for easy operation

• Real-time selection updates and error prompts for a smooth user experience


How It Works

1. Install the Ollama Auto Fill plugin in Figma

2. Ensure the local Ollama service is running (default address: http://localhost:11434)

3. Select one or more text components in your Figma design

4. Run the Ollama Auto Fill plugin

5. Enter your prompt in the plugin interface

6. Click the "Generate Text" button

7. Wait for text generation to complete, and the generated text will automatically fill the selected text components


Why Use Ollama Auto Fill?

• Save time: Quickly generate realistic and contextually appropriate text content

• Enhance creativity: Get inspired by AI-generated text for your designs

• Improve workflow: Seamlessly integrate text generation into your Figma design process

• Maintain privacy: Utilize a local language model for data security


Requirements

• Figma desktop app

• Locally installed and running Ollama service (default address: http://localhost:11434)


Notes

• Ensure the Ollama service is running locally and accessible

• The plugin requires at least one text component to be selected to generate text

• The number of generated text items will match the number of selected text components


Ollama Auto Fill streamlines your design process by providing instant, high-quality text content. Try it now and experience the power of local AI-assisted text generation in your Figma designs!

accepted.name: leolee
accepted.description: Design & Code

plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin that uses the Ollama local language model to auto-generate and fill text

plugins.name: Eternal Variable Export
plugins.description:
Export library variables, library styles, local variables and local styles to CSS variables and classes (for text and effect styles).


To export styles which are included in a library, you will need to go to the library file and copy the style keys from within the plugin, then go back to the file you are exporting from and paste the keys into the 'Include External Style Keys' input field. This is required because Figma does not make the styles accessibile within their APIs. Make sure your library has been published when exporting styles to ensure the output includes the changes.


Alternatively export as JSON and write your own scripts to convert into any style format you need.


Todo:

  • Make it clearer how to include external styles
  • Support additional export modes (e.g. scss)
  • Something missing? Get in touch
plugins.tagline: Export external library variables & styles, local variables & styles to css variables

plugins.name: Tailwind CSS v4 variables to Figma
plugins.description:
Tailwind CSS v4 variables to Figma


A Figma plugin that allows to input CSS variables in Tailwind v4 format and introduces the feature to import them in Figma as Local Variables or Local Styles.


Current Stage

This plugin supports formats:

  1. HEX
  2. RGBA
  3. RGB


Usage

Local Variables

If you choose to import the CSS variables as Local Variables you should fill the "Collection Name" input field in order to give a name of the collection where the variables will be stored.


If a collection with this name exists it will append or override the inported variables to the collection.


The CSS variables are entered in the big textbox "CSS Variables"


Local Styles

If you choose to import the CSS variables as Local Styles it is only required to fill the "CSS Variables" textbox


If there are styles that already exist they will be overriden.
plugins.tagline: Import your Tailwind v4 config CSS variables in Figma as variables or styles

plugins.name: Circle Packing
plugins.description:
Packing circles with random sizes in a given shape.


Please try the tutorial below first


Tutorial

  1. Create a Frame with a white background and set its size to 400 x 400.
  2. Draw a black circle (#000000) with a size of 300 x 300, centered within the frame.
  3. Open the plugin and make sure the Mask Color is black (#000000)
  4. Select the Frame and click "Generate."
  5. Adjust the settings and enjoy!


Input Settings

  1. Mask Color: The part inside the frame where circles can be generated inside.
  2. Filter Quality: (0 - 100%) In a large Frame, reducing filter quality will help it generate faster.


Output Settings

  1. Num of Circles: (1 - 10,000) The maximum number of circles that can be generated.
  2. Circle Color: The color of the generated circles.
  3. Min. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The smallest radius for the generated circles.
  4. Max. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The largest radius for the generated circles. If the minimum and maximum values differ, each circle's radius will be randomly chosen between these two values.
  5. Padding Radius: (0 - 10,000) The extra radius (space) between circles to prevent them from overlapping.
  6. Bias: (0 - 10,000) When set to 0, circles have an equal chance to be any size between the minimum and maximum. When set to 1 or higher, circles will tend to be either very large (first) or very small (if it cannot fit).
  7. Num of Attempts: (1 - 1000) The number of tries to add circles. For example, if the number of circles is set to 500 and attempts are set to 5, the plugin will try to generate 500 circles. If the first attempt fails, it will try up to 5 times. This means it will try up to 2,500 times or stop once 500 circles are successfully created.


Pricing

  1. 10 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access and future updates for a one-time purchase.

accepted.name: Saranomy
accepted.description: I make premium Figma Plugins

plugins.tagline: Generate Random Circles inside Given Shape

plugins.name: Guideflow - AI-Powered Interactive Demos & Guides
plugins.description:
Guideflow Figma Plugin: Transform Your Figma Designs into Interactive Demos and Guides with Ease


The Guideflow Figma plugin empowers designers and non-designers alike to quickly turn Figma frames into interactive demos, step-by-step guides, GIFs, and videos. Whether you’re working in product, marketing, customer success, or design, Guideflow makes it simple to create engaging, dynamic presentations from your Figma designs, without needing any coding skills.


Why use Guideflow?

Guideflow takes your Figma frames and brings them to life, providing a seamless transition from static design to interactive experience. Whether you're preparing a product demo, creating user guides, or showcasing design concepts, Guideflow allows you to elevate your communication by transforming designs into fully functional, trackable walkthroughs and videos.


Key Benefits:


Instant Interactive Demos

Export your Figma frames directly to Guideflow, where you can build interactive demos in minutes. Whether for a product demo or a UX flow, Guideflow allows you to visually guide users through the design, providing them with a hands-on experience.


Step-by-Step Walkthroughs

Create detailed walkthroughs for any use case, including user onboarding, tutorials, and internal training. Each step can be annotated with helpful instructions, animated elements, and dynamic transitions, guiding viewers through the process effortlessly.


Flexible Output Options

Choose how you want to share your interactive demos or guides. With Guideflow, you can generate interactive web demos, export GIFs, or create polished videos from your Figma frames. Whether you need a live interactive demo or a shareable video presentation, Guideflow has you covered.


Enhanced Collaboration & Feedback

Empower your entire team to participate in the design process. Guideflow allows designers, marketers, and product managers to collaborate seamlessly, sharing interactive demos or guides for feedback, validation, or user testing. Real-time sharing and engagement tracking ensure that your team and stakeholders are always on the same page.


No Code Required

Anyone can create with Guideflow, even without design or coding expertise. Simply select the frames from Figma, export to Guideflow, and start adding interactivity like animated hotspots, transitions, and voiceovers—all without needing a single line of code.


Features that Set Guideflow Apart:

Customizable Elements: Add voiceovers, branching paths, embedded forms, and animated annotations to personalize your demo or guide.


Real-Time Engagement Tracking: See who’s interacting with your demos, track viewer engagement, and identify drop-off points to improve your content.


Multiple Sharing Options: Share your interactive demo as a personalized link, embed it directly into websites or documents, or export it as an MP4 or GIF for easy distribution.


How to Get Started:


  1. Select Your Figma Frames: Choose the specific frames or series of frames from your Figma project that you want to bring into Guideflow.
  2. Export to Guideflow: With the click of a button, your selected frames are transferred to Guideflow, where you can begin to enhance them with interactivity, guidance, and customization.
  3. Add Interactive Elements: Use Guideflow’s intuitive interface to add animations, transitions, voiceovers, or text annotations. Highlight key actions and guide your audience through each step.
  4. Share & Track Engagement: Once your demo or guide is complete, share it with your team or users via a link, embed it in web pages, or export it as a video or GIF. Monitor engagement and get insights into user interactions.


Use Cases:

  1. Product Demos: Perfect for showcasing new features or flows to clients and stakeholders.
  2. User Onboarding: Build step-by-step guides to help new users get up to speed quickly and efficiently.
  3. Design Feedback: Share interactive designs with your team for feedback, reviews, or testing, ensuring everyone is aligned on the final vision.
  4. Marketing Presentations: Export stunning, animated GIFs or videos from your Figma designs to support marketing campaigns, social media, or pitches.


With the Guideflow Figma plugin, turning your designs into interactive, shareable experiences is faster and easier than ever. Whether you're creating for internal teams or external audiences, Guideflow offers the flexibility and power you need to communicate your ideas effectively.
plugins.tagline: Create interactive demos & guides from Figma

With the Guideflow Figma plugin, turning your designs into interactive, shareable experiences is faster and easier than ever. Whether you're creating for internal teams or external audiences, Guideflow offers the flexibility and power you need to communicate your ideas effectively.
106302.tagline: Create interactive demos & guides from Figma

plugins.name: Plus Also Studios for Figma
plugins.description:
Rollout

Sync your images and copy with your main component designs in Figma to rollout multiple sizes and variations of your creative. This plugin is great for generating static or multi frame ads with lightening speed.

Features include:

  1. Resize your designs based on your main figma components
  2. Sync your content with a spreadsheet to create additional sizes and image and copy variations.
  3. The plugin automatically chooses the best template to use for new creative sizes.
  4. Group your creative variations on one page or multiple.
  5. Batch rename to your output files using formulas in your spreadsheet.


Generative AI

Extend your images, remove background, or generate new images directly from Figma.


Optimised Exports

Exporting images and optimise them (both lossy and lossless mode).


Display

Export multi-frame storyboards as production ready HTML5 display banners that are ready to publish. The output files are also compatible with Google Web Designer, in-case you want to craft your animations further.

Features include:

  1. Animate and export multi-frame banner designs with one click, from Figma.
  2. Control the duration of each frame.
  3. Add intro animations to each frame.
  4. Add outro animations to each frame.
  5. Auto animate button rollovers.
  6. Control the frame animation order.


plusalso is only available to subscribers. To trial or signup for an account, contact our team at support@plusalsostudios.com.au

plugins.name: Apply Absolute Auto Layout
plugins.description:
Apply Absolute Auto Layout


Have you ever applied auto layout to an icon frame, only for it to resize the frame and reposition the vectors inside of it? Here is the solution to your auto layout woes!


This plugin applies the following to each selected frame:


  1. Set auto layout, center alignment on both axes, fixed width and height, and restore original frame dimensions
  2. For each immediate vector child layer, apply absolute positioning and restore original x/y coordinates within the parent frame


And that's it!


GitHub Repository: https://github.com/Saeris/apply-absolute-auto-layout
plugins.tagline: Apply autolayout to your icons without risk of resizing or elements repositioning!
